lines.text: Babs, grab the life saver!
Who can think of candy at a time like this?
[after doing an obscenely loud sound demo prior to the movie]
The audience is now deaf.
[Buster is forced to marry Big Daddy Boo's daughters]
I can't marry all three of them, that's bigamy!
No, that's big o'me!
[the Pig family is singing "99 Bottles of Non-Alcoholic Beverage On the Wall"]
Call me picky, but isn't that song supposed to be "99 Bottles of Beer On the Wall"?
We don't drink in our family, Plucky!
Is it just me, or is it hot in here? How about turning on the A.C., huh?
Air conditioning wastes gas; I'll just crack the window.
Don't you dare, Wade! People will think we can't afford air conditioning!
Why, Buster Bunny, are you falling for me?

[as they fall down a waterfall]
You might say that!
It is not over until the fat lady sings!

[singing]
O'er the land of the free and the home of the brave!
Oh, Buster, I didn't think I'd get a chance to tell you...
Shh. I feel the same way.
I miss my family. I miss performing.
[Buster drenches her again]
I MISS BEING DRY!
Speak to me, Plucky!
Auntie Anne, is that you?
You know, Buster, I think we've gone far enough down this river.
Ah, relax, enjoy, the sound of the water, the soft croaking of the frog, the quiet whispering of the wind through your ears...
...the scary possum kid plucking the banjo?
Don't worry, Babs, he's just trying to communicate. Afterall, music is the universal language.
You know, that music does have some kind of... romantic charm...
[deeper voice]
If you know what I mean.
You know, Babsy and I want to tell you about the time we had riding down the river.

[transforms into Tina Turner and sings]
Hey! We're a rollin'... rollin'... rollin' down the river! Rollin'... rollin'... Rowan and Martin!
[speaks]
These are the jokes, folks, so feel free to laugh anytime... or not.

[falling toward a hole in the ground]
A plot hole?
I was wondering how those hack writers were going to wrap things up.
We hope you are enjoyin' Wild Safari Zoo! May I repeat, so that Warner Brothers won't get sued if anyone really does this - do not get out of the car!
[Elmyra gets out of the car anyway]
This little girl may just be what we need for our big show.
Show? Did you say show?
Well, actually, Babs here is anxious to get home to Acme Acres.

[impersonating Lucille Ball]
But Ricky, I wanna be in the show!
[falling down a waterfall]
I got ya! I got ya!
But who's got you? AAAHH!

[flying in and catching them]
I do, kids.
Hey pal, this is our story!
Yeah, get your own video!
It's your call.
[drops them]

[singing, dressed as a gondolier]
Veal parmigiana/ cream fettucine/ ravioli, clams with linguini/ hot pepperoni/ tasy spumoni...

[speaks]
we haven't eaten in weeks.

[singing]
Veal parmigiana, veal parmigiana!
Babs, that song really put me in the mood.

[hopeful]
for what?
Pizza! You got any money?
Thank you, Mr. Romance.

You know, you look kinda pretty there, stading in the rain. I love the way the wind rustles through your ear, and that shine the water makes on your fur... and your uncanny resemblance to a drowned rat when you get drenched.
Drowned rat, huh? I'll show you!
[raises pole to smack him and gets struck by lightning]
It's a romantic tradition of the South - beautiful homes, refined gentlemen, and delicate ladies.

[answering the door]
Yeeees?
Strike my last stereotype.

[rescuing Buster in disguise]
Lookin' kinda peaked there, son.
Ya took long enough.

[VERY sweetly]
I was enjoying watching you sweat.
Way to go, Huck Finn. We spent our entire vacation downriver! Summer's over!
Yeah. And I can't think of a better way to have spent it Babs, than with you.
[kisses her]

[rapturous]
Really?
Absolutely.
Aaah...
[Buster soaks her again]
[Byron the Basset Hound saves Babs and Buster by flying]
Hey, Byron can fly!
Who knew?
[after a long, toon-type, water battle]
I do this water thing to Babsy through the entire video.
[Sitting at the drive-in with Hampton's family]
They bring their own food to the drive-in. I don't believe this family.
[Plucky just got ran over by Hampton's family]
I think the left front tire is a little low.
[Fowlmouth butted in the movie concession line and is deciding what snack to get]
Let's see, Goobers or Raisinets... Goobers or Raisinets... You got a reccommendation?
[Guy he butted throws him into theatre]
Guess I'll never know the eternal answer!
[Fowlmouth got "thrown" into the movie]
At this rate, we'll NEVER get to my scene!
Then the crowd should thank me, you no good dadgum excuse for a dadgum actress!
[underwater]

[singing]
Beneath the ocean/Beneath the ocean/We make lots of commotion beneath the ocean!
Now what do we do first? The beach? Camping? Or shall we slip the whole 12 weeks away in front of the boob tube?
There he goes, my best pal on a vacation of a lifetime. Why don't I sit here and drop alone?
[Car rushes back]
Oops, dropped the toilet paper.
Do your ears look better dry?... or wet?
Mondo distress signal! Buster and Babs are like in peril! I'd rescue them if I didn't have this summer job.
The box look is in!
Way in!
Gee, Plucky, I guess you didn't get your wish.
Hey, neither did you guys.
to be a happy and loving family forever and ever.
Oh joy, oh rapture, oh for the love of Norman Rockwell and the Lettermen.

[referring to Buster]
Look, he's got no pants!
We've got snappers and crackers and poppers and bangers. We've got them Roman candles, yucky curly snakey things, and the little spinny whirly balls that never work.
Good Heavens, Plucky. If you drink that much water, we'll be stopping again in no time!
That was my photograph! I cannot believe you!
Yeah? Well, I am pretty unbelievable.
You are nothing but a selfish, worthless waste of skunk! You, monsieur Pew, stink!
[Fifi kicks Johnny and sends him flying out of the movie theater into Elmyra's arms]
Ooooh! I got myself a kitty! Hello my stinky little kitty hon! Say hello to Mommy Elmyra!
Oh no!
[Johnny tries to run away but Elmyra catches him]
Oh yes! I'm gonna change your diapers, give you a bath, and even potty train you!
Plucky? Wake up. We're almost there.
Heaven?
Happy World Land!
[Plucky is kissing the lawn]
Careful, Plucky. We just had the lawn fertilized.

[falling down a hole towards a light]
Head towards the light.
Do we have a choice?
There's that nice young man we met.
WWAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHH!
Did you give him our address?
No, Mom. I gave him Plucky's.
WHAT?
Whoa! That was some time we had there!
I'll say! Now let's go home.
Okay, Mom.
B-b-but we didn't do anything! All we did was ride around in the monorail!
Can't do it all on the first visit, Plucky. Maybe you'll have to look forward to the next time we come.
WHAT? BUT WE CAME ALL THAT WAY... COULDN'T WE... ALL THAT TIME... FUN PIXIES... HAPPY-GO-PUKEY?
Oh dear, I guess Plucky's had way too much excitement for one day.
Put him in back, Hampton.
Okay.

[singing out of his mind]
Happy World Land... Happy World Land... where all your dreams come true...

[singing]
Happy World Land. Happy World Land. Where the fun will never stop, at only 80 bucks a pop. The beautiful Happy World Land.
Well, skin me alive and call me luggage!

[after losing the Aligators in the fireworks]
Happy Independence Day.
And as Ben Franklin once said, let's vote.

[immitating Boris Karloff]
Nice place to live if you have a bolt on your neck.
Rub it in, Boris!

[after climbing on the "raft" and seeing someting on her foot]
There's something on my foot. AAAHH! IT'S THE CREEPING UNKNOWN! IT'S NOT OF THIS EARTH! Buster, you've got to save my foot. It's my lucky rabbit's foot!

[pulls it off]
Hey, it's Byron.
Who knew?
Possums
Gators
Dinner Theater
Main Course
Options
One
Bolt?
Bingo
Ready
Go!

[thinking Babs is a man]
Are you married? Hmmmmmm?
Sure am.
[grabs Byron in a dress]
Meet the missus.
Wwwwooouf.
a pristine mint condition first printing of 'Immature Radioactive Samurai Slugs', number one!
Ooh, now Plucky, we don't allow Hamton to read comic books on family trips.

[sarcastically, gives the comics to Hamton]
Sheesh! Typical parents convinced comics will sabotage cerebellum.

[feeling nauseous]
It's not that. Reading in the car always makes me...
[gulps in sickness]
... carsick.
[Buster and Babs are given a round of applause for their act]
Thank you!
Sounds like a terrfic audience!
A lot nicer than some of the creeps we met on this trip.

[laughs]
You said it. Hey, let's turn up the houselights and get to know each other better.
[the houselights turn on revealing the creepy, hungry creatures they met down river along with some others]
Looky, girls, it's our beau with no pants!

[while escaping from the killer, parody of Loretta Lynn, sings with Byron]
I was born a coal digger's daughter.

[cynically]
Great. Now we're in a rerun of 'Hee-Haw'.

[facing an angry lion]
Well, if it isn't the king of the jungle.
[the lion roars in her face]
You don't have to yell. I know what you want - you want a haircut!
[grabs him and shaves his head, giving him a crewcut]
There, isn't that preferable?
[holds up a mirror; the lion screams]
Long hair is SO retro.
Are we anywhere remotely near Happy World Land yet?
No, but if you're bored we can always play...
Spot-the-car? Spot-the-car?
Spot-the-car!
Whoopee!
Oh, you mean like spot the red cars or the cars with out-of-state-plate?
No, any car!
Here they come!

[jumping up and down]
There's a car! There's a car! There's a car! There's a car! There's a car!
[laughter]

[squashed]
Fun game.
Look, look! Here come some more!
There's a car! There's a car! There's a car! There's a... Oops! Truck!
[laugter]
Shoot me.
[after picking up a creepy-looking hitchhiker]
a psychotic killer has escaped from the state maximum security prison. The raving maniac has been described as a lanky man with straggly hair and a pasty complexion.
[Plucky looks at the hitchhiker - he matches the description]
When last sighted, the homicidal fiend was wearing a dirty baseball cap, tattered overcoat, and green hightops.
[Plucky looks at the man's shoes - they are orange]
Whew!
Wait, I'm sorry. That's ORANGE hightops.
Mama!
[Plucky starts writing it down when Winny shuts off the radio]
Honestly, there's so much sensationalism in the media these days.
Oh, no! One of those possums!
Aw, shoot! Don't fret none missy. I ain't like my simple backwoods cousins. I'd never eat a guy who could play his face.
See, Babsy? I told you music was the universal language.

[sarcastically]
And here I thought it was Esperanto.

[reading to a group of captured animals]
And the most feared predator in the jungle is - ME!
[holds up picture of herself, giggles]
Kiss me! Kiss me! Kiss me!
[the animals run off screaming]
Aminals can be so capricious.
Over here, Barbara Ann Bunny!
DON'T CALL ME THAT!
[being swept downriver]
So how do we stop this thing?
We don't.
So long, Acme Acres.
Hello Adventure!
You know, Babsy, in this moonlight you look just like... Morey Amsterdam.

[enraged]
MOREY AMSTERDAM?
[Buster soaks her again]
Cuckoo! Cuckoo! If you're late for the first day of school, you're a cuckoo!

[as school starts]
Hot dang, I'm gonna get me some edu-ma-cation!

[giving Furball swimming lessons]
You're not going to learn anything floating on the bottom of the pool.
I'm gonna go on every ride 'til I barf twice!
In summer, Dizzy shed. If Dizzy spin, Dizzy be naked.

[singing]
We're waiting for the clock to strike three/ When it's three o'clock we'll be free.
Then it's adios, Looniversity/
Summertime is coming finally!
Say goodbye to teachers and books!
See you in September, you schnooks!
All summer long we'll be free/ Come on stupid clock, please! Strike three!
We almost went looney/ from counting days till Juney/ now this afternoony/ summertime is here!
A three month vacation...
For kids across the nation.
Whatever your location...
It's the best time of the year!
Visit Acme Acres for a cool-down in the sun/ Beat the heat, it's a treat, that's for everyone/ We're Tiny, we're Tooney, we're all a little looney/ It's Tiny Toon Adventures with some summer fun!
Now the video's begun.

[sung]
We're sad, we're confessin'/ that school is back in session/ I sure learned my lesson/
I actually had fun!
I'm filled with elation/ I'm back from that vacation!
For my next incarnation/ I'm coming as a nun!
Welcome back to Acme Woo/ for a new school year!
Yikes, a test!
I need rest.
I'm living in fear!
Johnny Pew was a pity.

[holding Johnny Pew in a baby outfif]
At least I got my kitty!
No more crate/ I now look great!
We've been outdone!
[last lines]
Tunnels, and car games!
Boy, that trip was sure lame.

[bringing in the deranged hitcher]
Here's our pal - what's his name?
SOMEONE CALL A COP!
You viewers are lucky...
Hey, where the heck is Plucky?

When weather gets mucky you can take it from the top/ When September rolls around/ you hear the schoolbell sound/ Never mind, press rewind, it's summertime again!/ We're tiny/ we're toony/ we're all a little loony/ It's Tiny Toon Adventures...
And I am the champ!
And now you are just damp!
[pulls a lever dropping a ton of water on Buster]
I just can't help myself!
In the summer, I will get a golden tan.
I will goof off every second that I can.
During summer break, I'll see the sights.
I will get a kitty and squeeze him tight.
I shall find the skunk-hunk of my dreams.
Wanna hug that kitty till he screams!
Summer is the time to hang with your best friends.
Our one wish is that the summer never ends!
We have all been waiting patiently/ waiting for the clock to set us free/ We will beg for summer on bended knee/ Come on stupid clock, please strike three/ strike one, strike two - Strike three!
[the clock strikes three and the bell rings]
You're out!
Oh boy! Here comes a tunnel.
Hold your breath and make a wish!
Ooh, I got my wish! A mall!
What the-?
Back to school sales! Buster, it's you!
Well what is it?
It's the new box look.

[rowing in a pouring down storm, cynically]
We're still downriver... and I'm STILL soaking wet.

[Furball runs away after Elmyra tries to teach him to swim]
Come back! We've got skydiving lessons at 4!

[laughs and puts on a hockey mask while revving a chainsaw]
Bacon!, porkchops!, hog jowls!

[listening to Hamton and his family singing badly]
The Von Trapp family they ain't

[looking through an animal book]
Ooh, ooh here's a pretty picture!
[to a gazelle she has tied up]
look Mr. Pretty face Gazelly that's you!
[shows him a picture of a gazelle about to be eaten by an alligator]
Kiss yourself!, kiss yourself!, kiss yourself!
[hits him in the face with the book repeatedly]

[Babs speaks in a seductive voice]
Duh, duh, duh
[as she pets his head]
humina, humina, humina!
Why Buster Bunny are you falling for me?

[as they're about to fall over a waterfall]
You could say that
[grabs onto her]
I got ya, I got ya!
But who's got you?
[screams as they fall over the falls]

[catches them]
I do kids!
Hey pal this is our story!
Yeah get your own video!
It's your call
[drops them]

[hums the words old McDonald had a farm]
... Pop goes the weasel.
So long, sayonara, and good riddance, I hope I don't have to go through that again.

[sees two women, one of whom is Fifi, with identical clothing]
Now, then, you both claim to be Michelle Lovitz. Will the real Michelle Lovitz please stand up?

[Hampton explains how to play the Car game]
So, what you mean you pick out the red ones, or the ones with out of state plates?
Nope! ANY car!
There's a car! There's a car! There's a car! There's a car!
[Uncle Stinky bounces onto Plucky crushing him into the seat]
There's a car! There's a car!

[Crushed under Uncle Stinky]
Fun game.

[writing a letter]
I'll send an S.O.S. to my sweetheart Shirley. Yeah! Once she's sees what a spot we are in, she'll rush to our rescue!

[Plucky puts the letter on a mailbox as the car he is in drives off. A mailman on a bicycle picks up the letter and rides down to his mail truck. The truck has a license plate that reads "I brake for coyotes". The Road Runner appears in front of the truck]

[sticks his tongue out]
Meep, meep!
[the mail truck runs over the Road Runner leaving him flat like a pancake]
